newsitem.title: USA: U.S. stock opening seen hinging on August payrolls.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stock opening seen hinging on August payrolls.

text.p: U.S. stocks were expected to take their opening cue from the key August employment due later this morning, widely seen as a factor in determining U.S. interest rate policy.

The data is due from the Labor Department at 0830 EDT/1230 GMT. Economists forecast 244,000 new jobs were created in August compared to 193,000 in July. The unemployment rate is seen at 5.3 percent, down a notch from July's 5.4 percent and average hourly earnings are estimated to have risen 0.3 percent, compared to a drop of 0.2 percent.
